document_title: What is HPV virus? Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
HPV is the abbreviation for Human Papilloma Virus - the virus that causes papillomas in humans. There are about 100 types of HPV that affect different parts of the body. About 40 types of HPV can cause genital tract diseases including: vulva, vagina, cervix, penis, scrotum, as well as rectum and anus, etc. Among them, about 15 types are considered is at “high risk” for cervical cancer. (first)
Infections caused by the HPV virus are often transmitted sexually or through skin-to-skin contact. Vaccination is an effective measure to help protect against HPV strains that can cause genital warts or cervical cancer.

Infections caused by the HPV virus are often transmitted sexually or through skin-to-skin contact. Vaccination is an effective measure to help protect against HPV strains that can cause genital warts or cervical cancer.
